data.text:
Lee Hye Ri, also known as Hyeri, is a South Korean actress and singer.

She initially gained fame as a member of Girl’s Day, before shifting her career into acting and appearing in Korean drama series such as Reply 1988 (2015) and My Roommate Is a Gumiho (2021).

Career

Hye Ri used to grow up in poverty at the countryside. She lived with her grandmother while her mother had to work in the factory.

Her luck changed when she was scouted at a talent show by Dream T Entertainment in 2010.

This Gemini woman was immediately put into the group Girl’s Day. At the time, the group just lost two members so they put her in. She received little to no training prior to this.

Hye Ri had her first release with the group in October 2010. They released an album titled Girl’s Day Party #2. The song Nothing Lasts Forever served as the title track.

Girl’s Day would go on and become one of the most successful groups in South Korea.

They have released many hit songs over the years, including Twinkle Twinkle (2011), Expect (2013), Darling (2014), and Ring My Bell (2015).

In 2012, Hye Ri made her debut as an actress. She starred in the TV series Tasty Life.

Then in 2014, she joined the variety show Real Man. A clip of her doing aegyo to the instructor went viral and she instantly became an overnight sensation.

She was dubbed as The Nation’s Little Sister by the media.

The woman from Gwangju got even more popular in 2015. At the time, she got a part in the TV series Reply 1988.

The drama was a huge commercial success, becoming one of the highest rating dramas. She was also praised by the critics and audience for her acting.

Over the years, Hye Ri continued to shine as an actress. Some of her most notable roles are in Entertainer (2016), Miss Lee (2019), and My Roommate Is a Gumiho (2021).

She also had her big screen debut in 2018 with the film Monstrum.

Boyfriend & Dating History

Ryu Jun Yeol

Hye Ri and Ryu Jun Yeol, a famous Korean actor, met while working together on the hit drama series Reply 1988.

They developed attraction to each other and started dating at the end of 2016.

Unfortunately, the couple announced their separation after seven years of dating in November 2023, for undisclosed reasons.

Net Worth

Multiple sources estimated that she has accumulated around $15 million to $20 million of net worth.

She earns most of her income by working in the South Korean entertainment industry as an actress and singer.

Charity

She donated more than ₩100 million to help children and funding AIDS preventions in underdeveloped Asian countries in 2019, and became the UNICEF’s Honors Club’s youngest member at 25 years old.

She made each ₩50 million donation to help improving elderly welfare through Community Chest of Korea in 2016 and to help the victims of Seomun Market fire in the same year.

In February 2020, she made ₩100 million to help those who struggles due to COVID-19 through Save the Children.

Plastic Surgery

There is no known information on whether she has undergone any cosmetic surgery to change her visual appearance.
